verses.roman:
haṁsa-sārasa-cakrāhva-
kāraṇḍava-kulākulāḥ
nalinyo yatra krīḍanti
pramadāḥ sura-sevitāḥ

synonyms: haṁsa—of swans; sārasa—cranes; cakrāhva—birds known as cakravākas; kāraṇḍava—and water fowl; kula—by groups; ākulāḥ—congested; nalinyaḥ—lotus flowers; yatra—where; krīḍanti—enjoyed sporting; pramadāḥ—beautiful women; sura-sevitāḥ—protected by the demigods.
translation: Beautiful women protected by the demigods sported in the gardens, which had lotus ponds full of swans, cranes, cakravākas and ducks.
